Spending time at home likely means more baking🍪, or more time outside☀️. Here's a fun activity you and your student(s) can do to help learn about gardening🌺.
Supplies Needed:
🥚Uncooked Eggs
🎨Markers/paints
☑️Soil
🌱Grass seed/chia seeds
💦Water
Carefully crack the top of the egg and empty it. Use the egg to make breakfast or some baked goods! Wash the eggshells thoroughly with soapy water and let dry. Once dry, very gently decorate the eggshells with markers or paints. You can use an egg carton to hold them upright. Share your creations below!

The Rainbow Mystery - Mike and Annie think like a scientist in this story all about rainbows. You can make your very own rainbow, and we'd love to see your results, just share the photo in the comments below.

Here's what you need: a clear plastic cup filled up 1/2 way with water; a flashlight; and a white piece of paper.
Carefully put the cup on the edge of the table so about 1/3 of it hangs over the edge. Hold the paper up behind the cup while you shine the flashlight from the bottom up through the cup of water. What do you see?!

October is ADHD Awareness month! Did you know that nationally 10% of children have ADHD? In North Carolina, that number has risen to 14%. While students with ADHD may struggle in areas of focus, organization, and even emotional health- but ADHD can also be a SUPERPOWER! Let's change the narrative of ADHD being a disability and refer to it as it is: a different ability.

An awesome way to support your child with ADHD, is to sign up for ADDitude's Free "Parenting Class". This is an 8 week self-guided course will be delivered via weekly email newsletters from ADDitude beginning September 21 includes expert advice on ADHD in boys vs. girls, oppositional defiance, screen time, meltdowns and anger, friendships and social skills, ADHD in teens, and much more.

October is ADHD Awareness month! Did you know that nationally 10% of children have ADHD? In North Carolina, that number has risen to 14%. While students with ADHD may struggle in areas of focus, organization, and even emotional health- but ADHD can also be a SUPERPOWER! Let's change the narrative of ADHD being a disability and refer to it as it is: a different ability.

An awesome way to support your child with ADHD, is to sign up for ADDitude's Free "Parenting Class". This is an 8 week self-guided course will be delivered via weekly email newsletters from ADDitude beginning September 21 includes expert advice on ADHD in boys vs. girls, oppositional defiance, screen time, meltdowns and anger, friendships and social skills, ADHD in teens, and much more.

post_text:
Food Lion + Cabarrus Charter Academy = Increased Math Success

Our Math Night at Food Lion was a success! Thanks to Store Manager Walter Bost along with Customer Service Managers Kelly Ward and Amelia Barton!
Our students were able to utilize their math skills that they have learned in their classrooms and put it to use in a real-world setting by actually walking through Food Lion adding and subtracting inventory, weighing produce, and estimating the total cost.
We had a blast and our students, parents, staff, and Food Lion employees loved the collaboration.
Food Lion gave our first 15 students that showed up a $10 gift certificate. Upon completing their math worksheets, students were rewarded with a delicious cake from the bakery, fresh fruit, a bag of chips, a bottle of water, and a Food Lion gift bag!
Cabarrus Charter Academy gives a big Thank You to our Partner in Education!
